ud5.2:1.5: Here I use “Blessed One” rather than my usual “Buddha” for _bhagavā_. Normally the difference is immaterial, as it is simply the most common way to address the Buddha. In this case, however, the passage Ānanda is referring to uses _bodhisatta_, and it is quite striking that he changes it here.
ud5.2:2.1: The Buddha switches back to _bodhisatta_, and depersonalizes it by using the plural.
